IRS990.MissionDescription: Andrew College is a residential, two-year college affiliated with the The United Methodist Church. Located in Cuthbert, Georgia, the College's mission is to provide an academically challenging liberal arts curriculum within a nurturing community.
IRS990.Description: Andrew College provides a high quality residential and non-residential liberal arts education. The average number of students enrolled in our two year program is 330. Academic & need-based scholarships are given to approximately 90% of our students.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: Via advertisements in local news media, in all college admissions material, and in the college catalog.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: College receives governmental funding under the Federal Student Financial Aid programs.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: Grants to students for payment of tuition.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The school applies the monies granted to students for tuition directly to tuition costs.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The College owns a house on campus where the President resides.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 was provided in pdf format to all directors for their review prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization consistently monitors compliance with this policy by distributing the policy handbook to all employees and Trustees annually.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The President's compensation is determined by the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees annually.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
The process has not changed from prior year.

The organization entered into an agreement with an outside third party for professional fundraising planning and consulting. No specific fundraising activity was managed by this individual, therefore, there were no specific contributions directly associated with the professional fundraiser.
